info.title: ZEDEDA Storage Service
info.description:
The ZEDEDA Storage Service is helper service to ZEDEDA Edge Application Service. This service allows customers to store edge application images and other artifacts (e.g. logo, screenshot, license, developer agreement etc.) in Datastores. This service allows customers to select datastores 
 -- ZEDEDA owned and operated Datastores in public cloud (AWS S3 or Azure Blobstorage) 
 -- Public Datastores (e.g. Docker Hub, Azure Container registry etc.) 
 -- Customer owned and operated Datastores in public cloud (AWS S3 or Azure Blobstorage) 
 -- Customer owned and operated Datastores in their own enterprise Data Centre 
 This service allows binary files of the images and artifacts to be uploaded in one of the above Datastores, artifacts to be downloaded from datastores. Edge nodes will download edge application image binary files from these datastores

get.description: Query the edge application image records.

400.description: Bad Request. The API gateway did not process the request because of invalid value of filter parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. The API gateway did not process the request because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The request header has either no authorization details or an authorization that has been refused.

403.description: Forbidden. The API gateway did not process the request because the requestor does not have edge-node level access permission for the operation or does not have access scope to the project.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The API gateway experienced an unexpected condition. Specific error condition is indicated in error codes.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The API gateway did not receive a timely response from an upstream microservice it needed to communicate with in order to complete the request.

parameters.name: summary
parameters.description: Only summary of the records required

parameters.name: filter.imageType
parameters.description:
Image type to ne matched.

 - IMAGE_TYPE_EVE: Base OS images for edge gateway
 - IMAGE_TYPE_APPLICATION: Edge application images
 - IMAGE_TYPE_EVEPRIVATE: Private Base OS images for edge gateway

parameters.name: filter.imageStatus
parameters.description:
Image status to be matched.

 - IMAGE_STATUS_CREATED: Image metadata is created
 - IMAGE_STATUS_UPLOADING: Image binary is being uploaded to Datstore
 - IMAGE_STATUS_READY: Image is ready for download
 - IMAGE_STATUS_INUSE: Image is being used by edge applications
 - IMAGE_STATUS_FAILED: Image binary upload has failed
 - IMAGE_STATUS_UPLINKING: Image metadata is being uplinked with Datstore binary

parameters.name: filter.datastoreId
parameters.description: Datastore id to be matched.

parameters.name: filter.imageArch
parameters.description: Image architecture to be matched.

parameters.name: filter.namePattern
parameters.description: Image name pattern to be matched.

parameters.name: next.pageToken
parameters.description: Page Token

parameters.name: next.orderBy
parameters.description: OrderBy helps in sorting the list response

parameters.name: next.pageNum
parameters.description: Page Number

parameters.name: next.pageSize
parameters.description: Defines the page size

parameters.name: next.totalPages
parameters.description: Total number of pages to be fetched.

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: User-Agent specified id to track a request

put.summary: Uploads edge application image binary file
put.description: Uploads the edge application image binary file in the datastore. This method uses multiple HTTP requests to upload image binary file in smaller chunks. Recommended for larger file size.

202.description: Accepted. The API gateway accepted the request for uploading but the upload process has not been completed. Please check ImageStatus and ImageError fields to track the status of upload process and any error messages.

400.description: Bad Request. The API gateway did not process the request because of missing parameter or invalid value of parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. The API gateway did not process the request because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The request header has either no authorization details or an authorization that has been refused.

403.description: Forbidden. The API gateway did not process the request because the requestor does not have edge-node level access permission for the operation or does not have access scope to the project.

404.description: Not Found. The API gateway did not process the request because the requested resource could not be found.

409.description:
Conflict. The API gateway did not process the request because 
 -- another request for uplink / upload is already in progress 
 -- image has been already uploaded, can't be modified again

500.description: Internal Server Error. The API gateway experienced an unexpected condition. Specific error condition is indicated in error codes.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The API gateway did not receive a timely response from an upstream microservice it needed to communicate with in order to complete the request.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: User defined name of the image, unique across the enterprise. Once image is created, name can’t be changed.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: part of the image binary

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: User-Agent specified id to track a request

parameters.name: Content-Range
parameters.description: Content range in this request. Example : bytes 1024-2047/8192

put.summary: Uploads edge application image binary file
put.description: Uploads the edge application image binary file in the datastore. This method uses single HTTP request to upload the entire image binary file. Recommended for smaller file size.

202.description: Accepted. The API gateway accepted the request for uploading but the upload process has not been completed. Please check ImageStatus and ImageError fields to track the status of upload process and any error messages.

400.description: Bad Request. The API gateway did not process the request because of missing parameter or invalid value of parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. The API gateway did not process the request because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The request header has either no authorization details or an authorization that has been refused.

404.description: Not Found. The API gateway did not process the request because the requested resource could not be found.

409.description:
Conflict. The API gateway did not process the request because 
 -- another request for uplink / upload is already in progress 
 -- image has been already uploaded, can't be modified again

500.description: Internal Server Error. The API gateway experienced an unexpected condition. Specific error condition is indicated in error codes.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The API gateway did not receive a timely response from an upstream microservice it needed to communicate with in order to complete the request.

get.description: Query the datastore records.

400.description: Bad Request. The API gateway did not process the request because of invalid value of filter parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. The API gateway did not process the request because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The request header has either no authorization details or an authorization that has been refused.

403.description: Forbidden. The API gateway did not process the request because the requestor does not have edge-node level access permission for the operation or does not have access scope to the project.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The API gateway experienced an unexpected condition. Specific error condition is indicated in error codes.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The API gateway did not receive a timely response from an upstream microservice it needed to communicate with in order to complete the request.

parameters.name: summary
parameters.description: Only summary of the records required

parameters.name: filter.namePattern
parameters.description: Datastore name pattern to be matched.

parameters.name: filter.dsType
parameters.description:
Datastore type to be matched

 - DATASTORE_TYPE_HTTP: Datastore hosted on HTTP server
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_HTTPS: Datastore hosted on HTTPS server
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_AWSS3: Datastore hosted on AWS S3
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_SFTP: Datastore hosted on SFTP server
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_CONTAINERREGISTRY: Datastore hosted on Container Registry (e.g. Dockerhub, Azure Container Registry etc.)
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_AZUREBLOB: Datastore hosted on Azure BlobStorage
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_ZEDEDAS3: ZEDEDA Owned and Operated datastore hosted on AWS S3
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_ZEDEDABLOB: ZEDEDA Owned and Operated datastore hosted on Azure BlobStorage
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_FILE_STORAGE: Datastore hosted on File Storage (e.g. HTTP, HTTPS, AWS S3, SFTP, Azure Blob, etc.)

parameters.name: next.pageToken
parameters.description: Page Token

parameters.name: next.orderBy
parameters.description: OrderBy helps in sorting the list response

parameters.name: next.pageNum
parameters.description: Page Number

parameters.name: next.pageSize
parameters.description: Defines the page size

parameters.name: next.totalPages
parameters.description: Total number of pages to be fetched.

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: User-Agent specified id to track a request

400.description: Bad Request. The API gateway did not process the request because of missing parameter or invalid value of parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. The API gateway did not process the request because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource. The request header has either no authorization details or an authorization that has been refused.

403.description: Forbidden. The API gateway did not process the request because the requestor does not have edge-node level access permission for the operation or does not have access scope to the project.

409.description: Conflict. The API gateway did not process the request because this datastore record will conflict with an already existing datastore record.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The API gateway experienced an unexpected condition. Specific error condition is indicated in error codes.

504.description: Gateway Timeout. The API gateway did not receive a timely response from an upstream microservice it needed to communicate with in order to complete the request.

parameters.description: User-Agent specified id to track a request

cleartext.description: flag to keep the contents of the volume unencrypted (in clear text)

tags.description: Tags are name/value pairs that enable you to categorize resources. Tag names are case insensitive with max_length 512 and min_length 3. Tag values are case sensitive with max_length 256 and min_length 3.

parameters.name: filter.runState
parameters.description:
- RUN_STATE_ONLINE: Entity Online
 - RUN_STATE_HALTED: Entity Halted
 - RUN_STATE_INIT: Entity Initializing
 - RUN_STATE_REBOOTING: Entity Rebooting
 - RUN_STATE_OFFLINE: Entity Offline
 - RUN_STATE_UNKNOWN: Entity state Unknown
 - RUN_STATE_UNPROVISIONED: Entity Unprovisioned
 - RUN_STATE_PROVISIONED: Entity Provisioned
 - RUN_STATE_SUSPECT: Entity Suspect
 - RUN_STATE_DOWNLOADING: Edge-node downloading entity artifacts
 - RUN_STATE_RESTARTING: Entity Restarting
 - RUN_STATE_PURGING: Entity Purging
 - RUN_STATE_HALTING: Entity Halting
 - RUN_STATE_ERROR: Entity encountered an error
 - RUN_STATE_VERIFYING: Verification of downloaded Artifacts in Progress.
 - RUN_STATE_LOADING: Loading of Artifacts into local datastore in Progress.
 - RUN_STATE_CREATING_VOLUME: Volume creation from artifacts in Progress
 - RUN_STATE_BOOTING: Entity booting up
 - RUN_STATE_MAINTENANCE_MODE: Entity maintenance mode
 - RUN_STATE_START_DELAYED: Application start delayed as per configuration
 - RUN_STATE_BASEOS_UPDATING: Device BaseOs Update in Progress
 - RUN_STATE_PREPARING_POWEROFF: device preparing power off - shutting down all app instances
 - RUN_STATE_POWERING_OFF: device powering off from local profile server
 - RUN_STATE_PREPARED_POWEROFF: device prepared power off - all app instances are shut down

id.description: system generated unique id for an artifact

name.description: User defined name of the artifact, unique across the enterprise. Once object is created, name can’t be changed

status.description: describes the status of the operation

signedUrl.description: generated signed url for an artifact

Artifact.description: ArtifactKey idenfies the artifact by artifactId
Artifact.title: ArtifactKey detail

ArtifactList.description: Response returned for List artifact Keys
ArtifactList.title: ArtifactKeyListResponse detail

ArtifactStream.description: ArtifactKey idenfies the artifact by artifactId
ArtifactStream.title: ArtifactKey detail

cert.description: base64 string of the parent certificate
cert.title: certificate details

pvtKey.description: base64 string of the parent pvt key

publicKey.description: base63 string of the public key

passPhrase.description: pass phase for the pvt key, this has to be filled if pvt key is encrypted with a pass phrase

exportable.description: Indicates if the private key can be exported.

reuseKey.description: Indicates if the same key pair will be used on certificate renewal.

cryptoKey.description: Crypto Key for decrypting user secret information

rsaEcryption.description: RSA encryption algorithm of the certificate

ecdsaEncryption.description: ECDSA encryption algorithm of the certificate

sanValues.description: This holds the alternative name values like URIs, domain names IPs etc.
sanValues.title: Subject alternative name values

subject.description: Parameters for the subject of the X509 component of a certificate.

issuer.description: Parameters for the issuer of the X509 component of a certificate.

serialNumber.description: Unique identifier for each Certificate generated by an Certificate Issuer.

basicContraintsValid.description: This fields tells the basic constraints like isCA are correct.

keyUsage.description: Key usage extensions define the purpose of the public key contained in a certificate.

certificates.description: List of Certificate object holds the details of certificate like cert block, encryption type, validity, subject etc

orderBy.description: OrderBy helps in sorting the list response

totalPages.description: Total number of pages to be fetched.

Cursor.description: Cursor helps in filtering the various list response like edge-app bundle list, model list, bundle list etc.
Cursor.title: Cursor is used as filter in list operation.

namePattern.description: Datastore name pattern to be matched.

example.name: my-test-datastore

id.description: System defined universally unique Id of the datastore.

name.description: User defined name of the datastore, unique across the enterprise. Once datastore is created, name can’t be changed.

title.description: User defined title of the datastore. Title can be changed at any time.

dsPath.description: Datastore relative path w.r.t. Datastore root

region.description: Datastore region - valid for AWS S3 and Azure BlobStorage

needClearText.description: knob for sending creds in clear text

projectAccessList.description: project access list of the datastore

apiKey.description: Datastore access API key in plain-text

apiPasswd.description: Datastore access API password in plain-text

projectDetails.description: List of projects which are associated with the given datastore

next.description: Responded page details of filtered records

DatastoreType.description:
- DATASTORE_TYPE_HTTP: Datastore hosted on HTTP server
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_HTTPS: Datastore hosted on HTTPS server
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_AWSS3: Datastore hosted on AWS S3
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_SFTP: Datastore hosted on SFTP server
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_CONTAINERREGISTRY: Datastore hosted on Container Registry (e.g. Dockerhub, Azure Container Registry etc.)
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_AZUREBLOB: Datastore hosted on Azure BlobStorage
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_ZEDEDAS3: ZEDEDA Owned and Operated datastore hosted on AWS S3
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_ZEDEDABLOB: ZEDEDA Owned and Operated datastore hosted on Azure BlobStorage
 - DATASTORE_TYPE_FILE_STORAGE: Datastore hosted on File Storage (e.g. HTTP, HTTPS, AWS S3, SFTP, Azure Blob, etc.)
DatastoreType.title: Datastore type

summaryByType.description: Type distribution summary of filtered Datastore records

summaryByCategory.description: Category distribution summary of filtered Datastore records

next.description: Responded page details of filtered records

DecsriptionCode.title: description codes for internal use (Gilas and Niles)

Description.description: Description encapsulates the top level Description of the operation
Description.title: Description encapsulates the top level Description of the operation

timestamp.description: Timestamp at which error had occurred

entities.description: objects referenced by the description or retry_condition

DeviceError.description: DeviceError store the error occurred at the device side
DeviceError.title: DeviceError is used to store the error details of the hardware.

createTime.description: Timestamp at which object was created

lastRefCountChangeTime.description: Timestamp at which object refcount was last changed

DeviceObjectUsageInfo.description: DeviceObjectUsageInfo provides the metadata of object usage on the device
DeviceObjectUsageInfo.title: DeviceObjectUsageInfo carries metadata of object usage on the device.

curve.description: ECDSA curve to be used while signing the certificate.

Entity.description:
- ENTITY_UNSPECIFIED: Invalid Device Entity
 - ENTITY_BASE_OS: Base OS entity
 - ENTITY_SYSTEM_ADAPTER: System Adapter Entity
 - ENTITY_VAULT: Vault Entity
 - ENTITY_ATTESTATION: Attestation Entity
 - ENTITY_APP_INSTANCE: App Instance Entity
 - ENTITY_PORT: Port Entity
 - ENTITY_NETWORK: Network Entity
 - ENTITY_NETWORK_INSTANCE: Network Instance Entity
 - ENTITY_CONTENT_TREE: ContentTree Entity
 - ENTITY_CONTENT_BLOB: Blob Entity
 - ENTITY_VOLUME: VOLUME Entity
Entity.title: Edge node components

EventQueryResponseItem.title: Event query response item payload detail

EventSource.description:
- EVENT_SOURCE_UNSPECIFIED: Default
 - EVENT_SOURCE_SYSTEM: Event is generated as a result of status change reported by edge node / application
 - EVENT_SOURCE_USER: Event is generated as a result of an user's configuration action
EventSource.title: Source of events

id.description: System defined universally unique Id of the image.

name.description: User defined name of the image, unique across the enterprise. Once image is created, name can’t be changed.

title.description: User defined title of the image. Title can be changed at any time.

projectAccessList.description: project access list of the image

projectDetails.description: List of projects which are are common among given list of images

next.description: Responded page details of filtered records

ImageStatus.description:
- IMAGE_STATUS_CREATED: Image metadata is created
 - IMAGE_STATUS_UPLOADING: Image binary is being uploaded to Datstore
 - IMAGE_STATUS_READY: Image is ready for download
 - IMAGE_STATUS_INUSE: Image is being used by edge applications
 - IMAGE_STATUS_FAILED: Image binary upload has failed
 - IMAGE_STATUS_UPLINKING: Image metadata is being uplinked with Datstore binary
ImageStatus.title: Image status

ImageType.description:
